annotation.spannedText: Effective immunisation is available and schedules have been developed for pre-exposure and post-exposure prophylaxis

classMention.mentionClass: Effective immunisation is available and schedules have been developed for pre-exposure and post-exposure prophylaxis

annotation.spannedText: They should be stored at 2-8°C and discarded if unused one hour after reconstitution

classMention.mentionClass: They should be stored at 2-8°C and discarded if unused one hour after reconstitution

annotation.spannedText: In those at frequent risk, who have had a booster after one year, serology every 3-5 years should be considered, and boosters given where needed

classMention.mentionClass: In those at frequent risk, who have had a booster after one year, serology every 3-5 years should be considered, and boosters given where needed

annotation.spannedText: If possible, expert advice on the appropriate management and schedule should be sought

classMention.mentionClass: If possible, expert advice on the appropriate management and schedule should be sought

annotation.spannedText: In the event of a hypersensitivity reaction to a dose of a pre-exposure course, these patients should still receive post-exposure vaccination if indicated, because the risks of rabies outweigh the risks of hypersensitivity

classMention.mentionClass: In the event of a hypersensitivity reaction to a dose of a pre-exposure course, these patients should still receive post-exposure vaccination if indicated, because the risks of rabies outweigh the risks of hypersensitivity

annotation.spannedText: When a hypersensitivity reaction occurs during post-exposure immunisation, further doses should be given under close medical supervision

classMention.mentionClass: When a hypersensitivity reaction occurs during post-exposure immunisation, further doses should be given under close medical supervision

annotation.spannedText: Pregnant women and breast-feeding mothers should only be given pre-exposure vaccination if the risk of exposure to rabies is high and rapid access to post-exposure prophylaxis would be limited

classMention.mentionClass: Pregnant women and breast-feeding mothers should only be given pre-exposure vaccination if the risk of exposure to rabies is high and rapid access to post-exposure prophylaxis would be limited

annotation.spannedText: Post-exposure treatment should be given to pregnant women when indicated

classMention.mentionClass: Post-exposure treatment should be given to pregnant women when indicated

annotation.spannedText: Individuals with immunosuppression and HIV infection (regardless of CD4 count) should be given rabies vaccines in accordance with the recommendations above

classMention.mentionClass: Individuals with immunosuppression and HIV infection (regardless of CD4 count) should be given rabies vaccines in accordance with the recommendations above

annotation.spannedText: Specialist advice should then be sought urgently

classMention.mentionClass: Specialist advice should then be sought urgently

annotation.spannedText: Pre-exposure vaccination in England and Wales for individuals at high occupational risk is supplied by the Department of Health, and should be obtained from PHE Virus Reference Department in Colindale

classMention.mentionClass: Pre-exposure vaccination in England and Wales for individuals at high occupational risk is supplied by the Department of Health, and should be obtained from PHE Virus Reference Department in Colindale

annotation.spannedText: For advice on supply in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, see the contact details in the post-exposure recommendations section above

classMention.mentionClass: For advice on supply in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, see the contact details in the post-exposure recommendations section above
